Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MLO_9
Reviews.Content: Really great location, short walk to Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Lots of restaurants and shops on Avenue Des Ternes. Room small but very modern and clean. Found staff very helpful and friendly. Nice boulangerie/patisserie a few doors down the road.

Reviews.Title: “stay in”
Reviews.Author: Ted V
Reviews.Content: i just booked the hotel for next weekend because i saw many good reviews and the pictures of the room is quiet nice. but also some of them giving a bad review about the bugler. i really hope they more aware with this situation. i hope i have a pleasant day at Doisy. i will give my review soon

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: manieast
Reviews.Content: Useful for the Congress Centre at Porte Maillot and near good restaurants. Friendly staff. Could be difficult for guests with mobility issues as the lift is up a few curved steps and even with a large suitcase, it is difficult to manouvre. Lovely eco-friendly toiletries - could do with a shelf to place own toiletries on. Good breakfast in open light and airy breakfast area with tables, sofas and newspapers. I'd certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice, clean hotel. If you could rate 4.5 I would.”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandBrian
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe, 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and all central attractions. Very close to Metro stations etc. The hotel itself was reaslly clean and tidy and the staff were friendly. The room was smallish I suppose, but I believe that is the norm in Paris, and I've stayed in smaller. I would deinitely recommend if booking online, I'm not sure I'd pay their walk in rates but we got two nights for €198 all in for a standard double room. I think their officially quoted price was €295 per night-it's not that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Doisy Etoile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vickie G
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was fantastic - very central within walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel was spotless very modern and the staff were very helpful and very polite. The receptionst had fantastic english - overall a great city break and we will go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anson D
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel in September 2011 for the first day of our European trip. It was in the afternoon and we asked the receptionist if it was a safe area. "Of course" she said and so we trusted her as well as the positve comments from Trip Advisor. We went in and out of the hotel throughout the day. We went to dinner that day at 8pm and returned by 10pm to find the hotel room safe completely ripped away and missing from the particle board shelf in the wardrobe closet. It was totally missing and NO signs of forced entry into the room. The police and locksmith agreed that the burglar had a room key (digital card type), and the hotel owner, Phillip, agreed that there was no evidence of forced entry, as the door automatically locks when closed, not to mention the window was secured when we exited. Needless to say, we were obviously "targeted" by a hotel employee as no other rooms were burglarized and none of our other possessions were searched except for the missing safe that contained our USA Passports, cash, jewelry, and irreplaceable important documents. We heard about the pick-pocketing throughout Europe so the room safe seemed like a secure option. Worse yet, the hotel owner would not even comp us for the one night where we stayed up to 3am at the police department filling out useless police reports that went nowhere. The owner said he would help out but then disappeared throughout the week as we anxiously sought replacement passports days later. The owner also said he would provide his insurance company name and contact information, but never did even after several email requests. He suggested our insurance company contact his insurnace company, but how could we do that without the contact information for his insurance? Bottom line: he kissed us off and said "Au Revoir." One other thing, the front door to the hotel was never locked until our burglary. During that week, they continually locked the door and screened each visitor.

Reviews.Title: “good location / good value”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel doisy for two nights while on a trip for the horse racing/40th birthday lovely hotel very clean good location and transport links excellent staff,would have been nice to have coffee making facillities

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small space, good value”
Reviews.Author: firegarden
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable - a 5 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Metro station. The hotel is clean - a bit on the small side, but European hotels are generally smaller than what we are used to in North America. All the elements in the room were ingeniously designed to make the most of the small space. Even the table lamp! And our room had one of the most comfortable hotel beds ever - almost as good as the Westin's 'heavenly' beds. Loved it!!! The free wi-fi was an added bonus and incredibly helpful for us. The front desk was also very helpful. It would have been great to have a coffee maker in the room. I need my caffeine fix in the morning and as we didn't have breakfast at the hotel, this ended up being a bit of a disappointment for a 3 star hotel. Even a simple electric kettle would have done. I would try to look for other options the next time but can definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: vered s
Reviews.Content: I came to paris to the OECD for work. The hotel was very clean, quiet and 5 min away from a bus that took me straight to the OECD. Great location, helpful staff and c l e a n. Also, I'm on a budjet so the price fitted too.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find better!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby B
Reviews.Content: well we staid in this hotel for two days. it was really good compared to other hotels in the same area. the room was good and clean, bathroom was clean too. breakfast was fresh. very helpful staff. overall, it was good stay, and we can stay there one more time.

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: 26Traveller26
Reviews.Content: Great location and staff very helpful. Our room was very clean and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmtazz
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Paris and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Rooms too small for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: MCCMalta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and good, very close to Arc de Triomphe. The staff speaks English very well and are very helpful and nice (especially needed when I had my mobile stolen). The location is great too. Room cleaning was good but not perfect...however nothing to really grumble about, just needed a bit more of a personal touch (eg remove empty bottle from shelf) but its fine - nothing really to complain about. It also provdes free wifi which IS a very good thing especially when you are on a business trip. The only thing to point out is that the room is extremely tiny compared to the price that one pays. Its true that in Paris rooms are not that big - however we barely could move if one of us was sitting at the desk/dressing table.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Carole G
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be great and the staff extremely helpful. For a start the instructions given on how to find the hotel were easy to follow and this is not always the case. The rooms were very nice if somewhat small.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anders E
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, relatively large room, great bathroom, fine breakfast and good service at desk. Somewhat expensive, but quality of our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: Facilities in room were quite basic, but the room was very clean, and the bathroom is modern and spacious. Very safe area, and lots of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Y Z
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Paris and the Doisy Hotel was perfect for us- great location! great small hotel! great price! great staff! We will definitely consider staying here again-

Reviews.Title: “central position, good pricing”
Reviews.Author: TigerTo
Reviews.Content: A hotel to recommend. Some good restaurants, a metro station and very polite hotel staff as well as small, but clean rooms make a journey a pleasure. Perhaps one should take the comfort line of the rooms, because the classical line leads to the Avenue des Ternes, a little bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: melida27
Reviews.Content: The Doisy Etoile Hotel in Paris is a lovely boutique hotel located close to the Arc de Triomphe and within walking distance from a metro station. The hotel has a small lift, which was great since we had three pieces of heavy luggage with us. Our room was small, but we had the most comfortable bed! The bathroom was nice, very clean. Our room was facing a busy street, but noise wasn't an issue because of the thick window glass. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel, which is great if you're arriving to Paris via train (about a 25 minute ride with traffic). The nearest metro station is right in front of the beautiful Arc de Triomphe (about a 10 minute walk from the hotel). There are also lovely cafes and bakeries all around the hotel. There's a cafe at the end of the block (I cannot remember the name) that has THE BEST creme brulee I've ever had! We unfortunately had a bad experience in Paris missing our train to Venice. When we returned to our hotel that they had already book the room to someone else and were completely booked. The head receptionist was a sweetheart! She tried calling hotels and hostels around Paris for us, but because of a tennis tournament, there were no hotels available in Paris. Being tourists in a foreign city, I felt overwhelmed, but they took care of us and let us sit in the lobby until the train station opened again. It was a rough night, but it really could have been worse. We were very grateful! Again, the hotel itself is lovely, and the staff were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSarah68
Reviews.Content: Great hotel was not dissspointed at all. Upon arrival our room was not ready however I did not expect it to be,before I could ask to store our bags until later I was told it was no problem to store bags. Reception staff were friendly and helpful gave us a map of the sights, where the Metro was and somewhere pleasant for lunch, this was all within the first five minutes of arrival. Upon getting into room later that afternoon found room to be clean and tidy and comfatable. Great location to main sights could not fault this hotel at all. My next trip next year to see Tour De France, I will stay here again. Try it you will love it. Did not use Brekfast facility as I usually do not bother

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, the location is perfect in a better neighbourhood, the rooms are clean, the bed is very good & big enough, the hotel is very quiet at night and the staff is helpfull. I recommend this hotel very much. Next time we go to Paris we might book the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disastrous stay”
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 2 months prior to our trip, after flying 24 hours we arrive at the hotel and was told our room may not be ready due to the toilet etc being broken and they already called the plumber. They said they'd move us to another hotel if the room remains that way. I was worried about something like this as there was another review about the rooms being overbooked. Unluckily we experienced a similar outcome. We were moved to another hotel "best western" which was terrible. The room was tiny and the shower didn't work properly. Definitely not to the standard we booked (we chose doisy based on the clean rooms shown from photos) I asked hotel to print me off a receipt doisy paid, doisy paid the hotel 100euro whereas my room rate was 134euro. I was denied the price difference refund. On the one night we did stay, the rooms were nice, however it's definitely not worth risking your trip as there are many hotels around that area! The hotel is very small with no baggage storage. (Except under the stairs which they claim no responsibility over) In terms of distance from the station/arc de triomphe...I found it pretty far (especially if you have a heavy suitcase) There are closer hotels to the station around the same rate and probably wont be risking your room being overbooked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dali2414
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent! The room modern decorated and clean. The staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, very welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Juvincent
Reviews.Content: My boy and me went for the first time to Paris and we stayed at this very cute hotel, eveyithing is green lots of nature, we specialy liked their welcoling and bath Eco products, great sleeping and it was only a five minute walk to the "Arch of Thriumphe", the rooms are a bit small but aparently that is normal in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: zeadad
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Paris and decided to take my wife for a mini vacation. I searched tripadvisor on hotels in the Arc De Triumph area. I had stayed in that area before and thought my wife could explore while I attended a day of business. The hotel staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean. It was a little difficult finding the hotel, but once we knew the location it was easy to navigate. The closest Metro is a little walk, but there lots of shops along the way. I would not recommend this hotel to someone who has difficulty in walking up/down stairs as the elevator goes between floors (you either walk up or down 1/2 flight of stairs to reach your floor). All in all, it was a very good hotel and we would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in PAris”
Reviews.Author: TimCharles
Reviews.Content: I chose the Doisy for its location close to the Palais des Congresse,but its also only a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and ten minutes to the Metro.The last minute rate over the internet was excellent value and the hotel was a charm.Very comfortable with a n attractive lounge,spacious bed room which was cool in hot weather,pleasant staff and clean.There were good value bars and restuarants around.If you wanted the mainstream paris toursit sites its a metro or bus ride but thats all very convenient.It was also very quiet I did nt have breakfast but it looked good.Also free internet that worked well

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: MarioBonacina
Reviews.Content: A very small hotel but 5 min walk from CDG Square and all points of interest. Room and toilet very clean and confortable, frontdesk young helpful and friendly, breakfast rich and tasty and WIFI Internet connection free in every room. Free safe box. Rates are appropriate at the location in Downtown, if you book on line prepayed you'll have discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickitalian
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful stay. The room was clean and tidy. Much more space than i expected. Very soft pillows and hip looking room. The staff was extremely good. They recommended a great restaurant around the corner called Caius. 39euro per person 3 course meal. It was great. Safe neighborhood and minutes to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “very good location, good choice especially for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Sule2011
Reviews.Content: new furniture, handy and clean , love to stay, and recommended xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A4-tje
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and good. near the Arcde Triomph (<10 minutes walk). the staff speaks English very well when your French is a bit rusty. if a comfort room is available you get a free upgrade which is always nice, the rooms aren't that big but good for the few waking hours you spend there. the bathroom is good with a bath which is nice when you've walked all day :-) the hotel had recently been rebuild for a modern look. the beds are a bit small so if you're long you might get in trouble (>1,85m) with your feet haning out. But for the price and where the it's located is it a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit short on quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagain011
Reviews.Content: The service is OK and the location is great. However, the rooms are extremely small and ordinary considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we were very comfortable here”
Reviews.Author: saroy523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Doisy for 5 nights in May 2011. Our room was small but very nice with modern design, a comfortable bed, and very nice (and very clean!) bathroom. Our room overlooked the busy Avenue des Ternes, but the windows kept out the noise in our 4th floor room well enough. The only negative is location. I felt it was slightly off-the-beaten track. However, the Arc de Triomphe is very close, a 5-10 minute (uphill) walk away. Plus the Metro station underneath the Arc connects to lines that get you to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, etc...so in the end, the location isn't a huge deal. We opted out of the hotel-provided breakfast since it seemed steep at 12€. Why eat at the hotel when you can stop at a cafe or boulangerie nearby? We'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent price-quality_Clean and new rooms”
Reviews.Author: RushGucci77
Reviews.Content: very small but good for price, free wifi excelent!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorbenKrogh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Doisy Etoile Hotel twice and really enjoyed it. Hotel rooms are nice, clean and relatively spacy. Internet works very well and there are even quite a few non-French television channels. I stayed on the 5th floor and even had a balconyt overlooking Avenue Des Ternes.. Kind and servicesminded crew.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: QueenScott
Reviews.Content: We'd booked the Doisy Etoile hotel after doing a lot of research on hotels in Paris and were delighted with our choice. Tthe location is couldn't be better, being literally around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe. There are lots of good restaurants, bistros and bars nearby as well as a great food market and shopping. Positives: First impressions from the entrance way were very good as it was spotless and very modern. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was perfect - small but everything was in it. With its' modern decor, flat screen tv, and a large bright and spotless bathroom - something I'm very fussy about - this was a home away from home. We got the best sleep we've had in ages too as the bed was so comfortable. Negatives: Catering is where things are not so good as there isn't a real kitchen with a chef and waiting staff. All that's on offer is a cold continental breakfast. The photos on the website and what you get are two very different things. It was ok for €12 but I like to be waited on when I'm on holidays and having to boil your own eggs was just a step too far for me. Breakfast at local eateries ranges from €7 to €15.50 depending on what you choose including scrambled eggs, bacon, smoked salmon. All in all, I would return to the Doisy Etoile and would recommend it to others. It's in a great location, it's clean and it's good value.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced but what else can you say - it's Paris after all!”
Reviews.Author: McPidd
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the Arc de Triomphe. Well served by the Metro and buses so getting around is no problem. Our room was good - overlooking the street but the double glazing was very effective and the noise from the street was minimal. However it was a small room considering what it cost so didn't feel it was great value but I think this is common to most hotels in Paris. Breakfast in the hotel didn't look great for 12 euros but there is a fantastic boulangerie a couple of doors down that provides for all your breakfast needs - so skip the hotel breakfast and go there instead! The hotel was very quiet and we particularly liked that for a small hotel there was always someone available in Reception to deal with any questions we had. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Overall we had a fabulous stay in Paris and would definitely stay at the Doisy again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: BraytonAK
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, fantastic beds, lovely modern design...there's really not anything to dislike about this hotel. My favorite feature is the bed. I looked forward to coming back to the room each night just so I could sleep. Breakfast was not included in our room rate, although we did take advantage of it a few times. It's rather expensive for what you get (€12). Breakfast offers boiled eggs, cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, pastries, fruit juices, tea, hot chocolate and coffee. You can get a cheaper breakfast at one of the cafes located nearby. The one offered in the hotel is more for convenience. The water pressure seems unusually high in my experience. The sink faucet would literally force water right out of the sink towards your legs. Fortunately we noticed this before we had been dressed for the day, saving us from watering our pants. The hotel design style is very modern with clean lines, cream and beige colors with splashes of pink and magenta. The location is in close access to both the Ternes and the Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro stations. As for new arrivals to Paris, if you arrive on a Monday, purchase a Navigo card. Otherwise, purchase a 1, 3, or 5 day pass which gives you unlimited use of the Metro trains and buses. I certainly recommend Doisy Etoile to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home , friendly environment”
Reviews.Author: malabojim
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located and close to Arc de Triomphe / Champs for shopping. One thing to note is it may be easy to arrive with luggage when walking downhill if arriving by train via charles de gaulle station , but would advise taxi for return especially if you have extra weight as ihappent is a bit of a climb back up. We arrived very early due to flight timing but was greeted warmly and was then offered a place to store our luggage until the room was ready which was fine.The hotel was very fresh and the cleanliness seemed to be very good. Upon arrival back to the hotel later in the afternoon we were checked in within 5 mins , and although i was a bit worried about the size of hotel public areas , and the lift , when we arrived at our room on the 6th floor i was surprised with the size of it.It had double and single bed being a triple room with also had a good sized bathroom with shower. The beds were very very comfortable and we overslept due to this and did not want to get up in the morning.All 3 of us said it was the best nights sleep for a long long time... We had breakfast the first morning of our stay and although only a buffet continental style was offered it was plentyfull and adequate for a good start to the day. On the second night another fantastic sleep was had by all , but we had to skip breakfast due to schedule , checking out was very easy and smooth and again done within 5-10 mins. Several questions were asked about getting around during our visit and the reception staff all spoke good english and were very helpfull. Would consider this hotel again if returning to Paris , thanks to all who attended us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and friendly hotel in a convenient location - a great base from which to explore Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MrWilsonSmith
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doisy Etoile is a five to seven minute easy walk from the nearest Metro / RER station, Charles de Gaulle Etoile. The directions on the hotel's website are clear and easy to follow so we had no problem following them. The staff at Hotel Doisy were really friendly. The hotel is pretty small too so our stay felt very personal. There is a light and airy communal area with french papers, comfortable seating and tables and chairs. Breakfast is served here, although we did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of places to pick up a croissant and a coffee nearby on your way out. There is also a great local cafe bar just round the corner off Avenue Ternes which serves reasonably (i.e. not excessively priced!) drinks and great food. Our room was quite small ( a 'confort' room, the cheapest one), but this was not a problem as it was clean, well appointed and the bathroom was nice (great rain style shower head!). Overall I would recommend as good value accommodation to use as a base to explore Paris from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: vcx1
Reviews.Content: A really easy stroll from the Arc de Triomphe and Etoile metro and also where the Air France bus stops from Ch D G airport. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. easy walk to local shops and restaurants too. We didn't have breakfast as many options nearby but it looked ok. Our rooms (108 and 107) were off the lounge/breakfast area which was great as we felt we had our own private sitting area as no one seemed to use it! Rooms not huge - but wouldn't expect it in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: karen37833
Reviews.Content: Jeremie was very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a triple room and the beds were very comfortable. We were 3 adults and felt we had plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Temprecord
Reviews.Content: I felt very well looked after, nothing was a problem. The receptionist looked after me by finding out all sorts of information for me. I was late for breakfast but it was not a problem and the choice was very good. The decor was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: caapi
Reviews.Content: Central, clean, reasonably quiet, reasonably priced. It's ideal for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: oftentraveling
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for my job and am very picky about where I stay. This is one of the nicer places I have stayed at in Europe, and is on my very short list of favorites. It is difficult to find better in Paris! My room was a good size, high quality bathroom fixtures, lots of TV channels (including English language), modern and very tasteful decoration. Very quiet, it is a good hotel for a nice night's sleep. The staff was extremely pleasant and attentive. There is an atrium lounge on the 2nd floor (french 1st floor) with comfortable seating -- a nice place to sit and relax, read, etc if you don't feel like hanging out in your room. This is a nice central location and very well-served by public transportation. For nearby shopping, most of the major French brands are right at your doorstep. Lots of different kinds of restaurants on the side streets off Avenue Ternes. HIGHLY RECOMMEND !

Reviews.Title: “Intelligent choice”
Reviews.Author: giomoura7
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel, near subway and Arc de Triomphe. Friendly staff, rich breakfast, confortable bed, ideal for couples, nice bathroom facilities, practic for wonderful shower. The rooms are not that big but are okay, perfect for having a rest at the afternoon after walking over Paris, and great for a good night sleep. The tv is okay, with all the french channels and the closet its enough. It would be even better if the room have more gargage bins, cause we only had one in the bathroom and it was not pratic to go there everytime to throw garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Zemeneses
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, speaks several languages Small room, but very clean. Best - Location (close to Triumph Arch and to the Beauvais shuttle); Staff Worst - Small room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nasosgeo
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky we found this hotel via internet,we had a great time.Very clean and nice rooms,it is wonderfully located and it is ideal for tourism or bussiness reasons.Nearby there are a wonderful bakery,a mini market that is open until 2a.m and the reception is open 24hours/day so everything you would need they are ready to help you.The beds are huge for the Parisian standards and very comfortable.We suggest it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lalaland0000
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel and was unsure what to expect as there are mixed reviews about it, happy to say we had a great experience! Great location, very friendly and helpful reception staff with great english, small hotel but this is to be expected in paris city, room was clean comfortable and nice decor. would recomend it!!

Reviews.Title: “great !!!”
Reviews.Author: bervinaa1947
Reviews.Content: I do indid recommend the Hotel Doisy for future travelers, its got great rooms, very comfortable showers, and the price was realy good for Paris. The staff speaks perfect english and were very nice, specialy Nataly and Jeremy, thanks to all their great tips about the city I was able to visit most of it in only 5 days!! I hope to go back one day

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mike_arcinas
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff -they speak fluent english!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: siebrand
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel Would recommend this. Less than 10 min. walk from metro, less than 15 mins. from Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “would definately recommend this lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eyelashwishes
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a long weekend and could not have asked for a better place to stay. The staff we so friendly and spoke excellent english (much better than my french)! The location is idea, about a 5 minute walk from the arc de triompeh and champs elysees and also there is a metro station just minutes away. Although it is on a busy shopping street, this did not hinder sleep or anything. It is a hidden gem as you would not notice it from the outside particularly. It has a modern feel and the best word to describe it would be 'fresh', especially the lobby area where breakfast is served (we didn't eat breakfast there so sorry can't comment on that). Only thing disadvantage I would say is that the television only had basic french channels but they do offer free wi fi so you could iplayer it up instead. All in all great trip and would defiately recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnnygip
Reviews.Content: We have just recently stayed here for 3 nights and could not fault our experience, staff were pleasant and helpful and the room was very clean,also within 4 min walk of the arc de triomph and city centre. Well recommended and wouldnt hesitate in staying again John and karolina

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, clean rooms, good and very acomodaing service!!”
Reviews.Author: nathavin
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed at hotel doisy en november and spite of the bad weather we had a great time, the personnel was very nolageble abot paris and very helpful with reservations and triks for cheap entrances!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Jose09
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is outstanding; its just a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe. The Passage Doisy just outside the main entrance is charming and leads to bistros and an excellent patissiere. We stayed approximately 10 days and without exception the staff was very courteous and helpful. Rooms are clean and recently renovated, but be prepared for small. Everything in this hotel is compact - tiny lobby, small elevator, narrow stairs. This hotel has to be among the quietest that I have ever stayed in and the beds were comfortable. We found it pricey, but is there a hotel in Paris that is not? On balance I would say it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “it's lovely”
Reviews.Author: Shyamali-Hasalaka
Reviews.Content: It is lovely hotel, very clean with exellent service. We loved our stay of one week there

Reviews.Title: “Reservation ist not sure despite of confirmation”
Reviews.Author: ensner
Reviews.Content: We had recieved a confirmation by E-Mail of our reservation about 2 months before the planned arrival in this hotel; before we hat to deliver the VISA number. 6 days before the planned arrival, the hotel tried to charge the credit card (1 night) - this was not possible, because they used a wrong code (backseide of the card) - but they never asked me this code.... They sent a Mail that they will annulate the reservation within two days (!!) in the case that I don't call them. Because I couldn't check my mails in the week before the planned stay at paris, they annulated the reservation, without further trials to come in contact with me, and this at a time periode, where paris is extremely crowded and there is no chance to find an alternative hotel. So I hat the costs of train, congress etc. and never reached Paris! It is the first time in my busy business travelling career, that such a thing happened....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.I highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: AHMED21
Reviews.Content: I went to that Hotel in summer,The Hotel is 3 Stars the room & Toilet is small but it is ok and Clean,The Location of the Hotel is very good 7 min from Arc De Triomph and 15 minutes to Champ-elysee .There is a lot of Coffee shop near the hotel so you can get your tea in the Morning and enjoy the Country. There is also a lot of stores for shopping like gap.celio,lacost in the same street .Also infront of bthe hotel there is Carrefour super market. The staff of the hotel are Excellent,There was lady called Julia she is very helpul when yo ask her any question she answer and also check for you the timming on net ,Excellent hospitality.also there is another lady called anstathia she is very nice and knew alot of places you can go. In General i highly recoomend that hotel as it is good price,V.good location ,excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Bgdv
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a good location, near Arc de Triomphe. It is near metro and bus stations. Rooms are comfortable and clean enough. Bathroom is clean except the towels. I doubt that they change them daily. There is no free WiFi and TV has only few french channels. Rooms has a good individual air conditioning system. All this plus signs are cancelled by staff method to treat the customers. First, we was surprised when we paid the entire journey at the beginning! Maybe they want to be sure that you don't leave after see the rest... In the last day, AFTER we left the hotel, without any notice, they discharge our bank account claiming we broke the safe box (this is obviously not true, they have no proof and I suspect they are using this method for many times. Could be the same safe box few posts below???). I'm wonder what stop them to change all TV sets in the room or towels or bed sheets accusing the customers that they broke them after they leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: shoegalf
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Doisy. The rooms are modern and new, the bathroom was spotlessly clean and modern. The stay was quiet and lovely. We had a good rate for the 7 days stay at 110 EUR per night which was a bargain. Stayed in 2 type of rooms, the classic room which was small and the deluxe room which was abit more spacious but both had a wonderful design, modern furniture and very clean. Both rooms had the most wonderful bedddd we loved it so muchh. The service at the reception desk was good and swift. The staff speaks Good English and were very helpful. The stairs was very steep and narrow, very difficult to bring heavy luggage and at one point i almost fell because it was so difficult to navigate. The lift was verry small and doesnt stop in all floor. You would have to stop one floor higher or lower, but in my opinion this is a minor drawback and understandable perhaps due to the small space available. The breakfast room was wonderful, airy and full of light with wonderful fresh design. Our deluxe room had a window facing the breakfast room but it was sill very quiet. Hardly any noise to bother us. The room was airconditioned and had windows that can be opened. There is a LCD tv in the room with mostly french channels. I did find CNN a few times but sometimes the signal dissapear, im not sure why. The location of the hotel was also very good. Close to 2 metro station Charles De Gaule Etoile and Ternes. The Air France Shuttle Bus Line 2 stop is also close by. 7 minutes walk to Arc De Triomphe via the Doissy passage behind the hotel cutting through avenue de Carnot and in minutes you can see the Arc De Triomphe. There is a Monoprix supermarket nearby and a boulangerie right next to the hotel. The surrounding area is lively with many shops and cafes. My suggestion is to provide a free wifi in the hotel. This was the only thing missing. This extra little thing can help the hotel to be more attractive. All in all we had a lovely stay and with such a good price we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service from the staff...”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: The Doisy seemed like an ideal choice at the onset. The location is close the the Metro and close to walking distance of the Champs Elysee and the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is decorated artfully in a modern style. The photos on the website are gleamingly perfect. Sadly, the customer service at the hotel is sorely lacking. The room was not ready at the check in time stated on the website and we were treated rudely at check-in. All other basic requests such as an area map or a restaurant recommendatioh were dealt with rudely. After we paid for wi-fi internet access and the code didn't work, I was rudely challenged by the person at the front desk. We were also overcharged by the hotel and resolving this doesn't bear talking about in how the hotel dealt with it. I need to say that I spend up to up to 75 nights per year in hotels and I strive to be a courteous guest and understanding of small inconveniences. I rate regularly on Trip Advisor and I hope my reviews are fair and informative. However, I have minimum tolerance for rudeness when it's not warranted. The only other hotel I have given a 1* on Trip Advisor was for that reason and I recently rated a hotel that had bed bugs with one more star than the Doisy --this is how offensive I find the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kissk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for 6 nights at the Doisy Etoile. First of all it is true that their reservation system is not very reliable. I made a reservation through their website, but due to change in flight program I needed to come a day earlier. I send them a mail asking for the change, they replayed that everything is ok. When I arrived, of course the reservation has not been changed, but they resolved the problem. Of course the question is what happened if they would not have free rooms. Beside this problem, the hotel is very nice. I stayed in a classic room which is quite small, but clean and comfortable. The shower is great. I have not tried the breakfast, you can get very good breakfast nearby for a smaller price. The location is very good, 10 minutes away from the Arc de Triomphe, the nearest metro station is only 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: martina39
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem. It's central location was superb just minutes walk from L Arc de Triomph and from the metro. The Hotel itslef has been recently refurbished and the rooms are clean with a modern decor. The Hotel itself is small but then again it's Paris where all rooms are quite compact. The staff were friendly and polite and there was no disturbance at night from noise on the street. For breakfast you can take a leisurely walk to the champs elyses and enjoy a relaxing coffee and croissant at Gerorge V. Round the connor from the Hotel is a quaint little bistro Le Hive. The food here was excellent - a must for the true French experience - like most Bistros in Paris it's closed on Sundays. Hotel Doisey was value for money and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “if Doisy hotel is received 3 star hotel, i think this hospitality industry will become worse.”
Reviews.Author: FC C
Reviews.Content: Doisy hotel appears very elegance with a nice location. Unfortunately, the owner and staff are not respectful with potential customers. They don’t have enough educated based on business activities; no knowledge about hospitality. For one instance, Doisy loves to break contact immediately without telling you his reasons till you arrive on his reservation desk. According to my experience with this worse-organized hotel, I learnt that I couldn’t trust this property anymore. Moreover, the receptionists never say ‘Excuse’ or ‘Sorry’ after they made mistakes on my booking. Therefore, first impression when I arrived to check-in was totally upset, horrible and unsatisfied. Hence, I recommend that Doisy needs to improve his staff, his hospitality knowledge, his CRM skills (customer relation management). Furthermore, while I was sitting besides the restaurant at the 2nd floor and played PAID internet, I was totally surprise by the worst actions between staffs in front of me. So, I think the stuff needs to improve indeed because - the throwing sacks upon your head by housekeepers, - the breaking glasses inside the tiny restaurant, - the bad conversation between two stuff ; back and front of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but staff were not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: x-istentialist
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It truly is walking distance to the Metro, the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysées. This hotel can be considered a small boutique hotel, by North American standards. The stairway is a bit daunting, with dizzying patterns and small spiraling steps. The lift provided emptied directly into the stairway, so carrying our luggage up the remaining flights of stairs was a bit dangerous. The room we stayed in was a triple room, it was a bit small, but that was to be expected for a boutique hotel in Paris. Wi-Fi is not free and is limited to 1 device only. We chose this hotel for location/price and because many other hotels in Paris didn't accommodate triples with a full twin bed, like the Doisy Etoile does. When we first arrived, we were told check-in was not until 3 pm (was originally thought to be 2 pm), however the hotel did store our bags for us. The only part of the Doisy that I think needs improvement would be the staff that works the front desk. I found that the staff working while we were there were not very friendly, nor interested in helping us (relative to all other people we encountered in Paris). Even just scheduling a cab pick-up for the check out morning proved unreliable. Considering price and location, I still would opt for a larger hotel chain, with more consistent standard services and staff over this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic three star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blacklabel75
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris for the weekend to watch the finale of the Six Nations Rugby, the hotel was booked by friends as they had stayed there in the past and liked it. I must say I was not disappointed. The location is fantastic, a mere 10 Euro cab fare from Gare du Nord and within walking distance of the Champs de Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English. I initially spoke to them in French but upon hearing my accent they were more than happy to converse in English with me. The boutique nature of the hotel is fantastic, especially if you want a quiet weekend away, there were only four rooms on my floor. My room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was very modern and was immaculate with a fantastic shower that was akin to standing under a waterfall. I also had an electronic safe which isn't always present in three star hotels. The owner of the hotel was brilliant and recommended a great restaurant a friend of his owned around the corner, he also wrote us a note to hand to the maitre'd and as a result we got a very good discount on a great meal. The only downside was that the breakfast wasn't worth the money but there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance so this isn't a major issue. All in all, a very high quality little three star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Loacation”
Reviews.Author: Gillymcc
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was perfect for a trip to Paris. Its bang on the metro yellow line which was good and its only a few minutes walk. The Champs Elysee is literally a 5 min walk, if even that so it was very handy for all the sights. The hotel itself was lovely and very clean. Only downside was they never gave us new towels and we had to go to reception and ask, but in the grand scheme of things its not a big deal. There is a great bar called Dada's nearby. Its great if you want to get a feel for what people do after work in Paris. Fantastic seafood restaurant called Le Bars des Fruits nearby, although I cant remember what street its on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in busy Paris street”
Reviews.Author: Shannahs_SG
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very well furnished, beds lovely and comfy. Triple sharing rooms are much spacious than the double rooms, lots of walking space although there's 3 big luggage on floor. Hotel is situated few blocks away from the nearest metro station (10mins walk) with easy access to Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysees. However, the room is quite stuffy and we have to sleep with open window.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Ryanair travellers”
Reviews.Author: Marinillo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located close to Porte Maillot, the station where you get when you fly RyanAir and take a bus from the airport. It's in one of the calmest district in Paris. Arc de Triomphe is at about 5 minutes walking. Apart from the location, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The room was extremely small. The distance between the wall and the bed was no more than 20 centimeters. The room was also quite dump and for this reason it smelled bad after a while. The bathroom was ok and the shower worked perfectly. The biggest remark I have to make is about the cleaning service. Towels aren't changed daily. Once I left the dirty towels (they were clearly dirty, like with big visible spots) on the floor and when I came back at night they hadn't been changed, but just nicely folded and put on the radiator. Another fail is that they do not have a free internet access, not even one single computer that one can use just to check emails or bus timetables etc. You can have access to the hotel wireless from your laptop or phone, but you have to pay 8 euro/day, which is quite expensive in my opinion. To sum up, even though the overall value is acceptable (we just paid 75 euro/night, which is quite an average/low fare in Paris) I would recommend this hotel only to Ryanair Travellers.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PEGGYAthens_Greece
Reviews.Content: a new modern hotel in the center of paris. everybody tries to make you feel like at home.i strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Staff, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EAMOH
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location in paris. The most important thing when staying in paris is to be on a good metro line, to be near all the sights, cafes and shops. This was pefect. 5 minute walk to arc de triomphe and the champs elysee. If you are in a bad location in paris its a disaster as you have to change metros a lot. This was near a great line which runs down the champs elysee taking in everything louvre etc. Also another line ran from the arc de triomphe to the eiffel tower. But enought about the location. The hotel was modern and staff were lovely. The room was nice not huge but bigger than most in paris. All in all the hotel was excellent and i will be back. I wouldnt stay anywhere else in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovtoholiday
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel well positioned. Staff were extremely friendly rooms were very well furnished, beds lovely and comfy bathroom well sized, everywhere spotless, beautiful little courtyard off the restaurant. Good variety of choice for breakfast. Little tip if you are looking for a quiet drink in the evening go out of the hotel turn right onto the main road and then left, few doors down lovely little French Cafe where the staff and locals were very friendly. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Freshly renovated small hotel with quiet rooms on the backside”
Reviews.Author: seeyou_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on busy avenue des Ternes about a 5 minute walk from Arc de Triomphe. A complete remodeling was completed this spring, so everything is quite new. We hade a room with twin beds on the backside which was very quiet, also no noise from other rooms. The comfort room was small with everything necessary, the bathroom with shower only. Breakfast is 12 Euros extra. The reception at the 24 hour desk is very friendly and helpful. Arc de Triomphe is not exactly in the centre of Paris, so you go to the hotel for sleeping. And for that it is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated-Modern -Clean”
Reviews.Author: GHAMILL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel 6 nights. We stayed in the confort room. On the small side but typical for paris. Everyting was new and clean including the bathroom. confortable beds. The NEW owner seemed to be on site most of the time and eager to please. He told me that the superior & the deluxe rooms were larger. We found the room rate to be inexpensive for this quality in paris. ( 130 eu per night ) You are just down the street from the arc de triomphe. We loved staying here and will be back soon. TIPS Take the air france airport bus from cdg to the arc de triomphe...From there you are only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. 24eu return each person. Pastry shop next door to the hotel...very good...inexpensive compared to competitors food market near 12 rue de ternes.....cheese,bread,olives,etc FINALLY...go to cafe francis in front of pont de l'ama after 10pm. order a champange and watch the eiffel tower light show. Gary Hamill

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: tsumScotland
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, recently modernised, interesting but small rooms, ( plenty of space for 2 if you are reasonably tidy. Good bathroom. Comfortable bed. Very quiet if you choose an inside room. Good buffet breakfast. This is privately owned ( I think I met the owner) obviously wants to ensure he provides good value etc. Sensible price ..well for Paris. Id be happy recommending business travellers who dont expect opulence and I'd take my partner there as well so good for pleasure trips. Great location loads of places to eat and drink etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: andrewww1
Reviews.Content: Clean room, Great location, Excellent hotel. We booked the hotel for a short stay in Paris and found a little gem. The hotel was easy to find and was just around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe, which also helped when travelling around Paris. The hotel was nice a quiet and the staff friendly. We will definitely stay again if we visit Paris again in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Doisy Etoile Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 55 Avenue des Ternes | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
